abstract: The departure of Southern Company and American Electric Power is a blow to a consortium seeking to build a carbon-capture coal plant in Illinois.
snippet: The departure of Southern Company and American Electric Power is a blow to a consortium seeking to build a carbon-capture coal plant in Illinois.
lead_paragraph: Two of the nation’s biggest coal-burning utilities said Thursday that they were withdrawing from a $2.4 billion project to demonstrate carbon capture and storage, and would instead pursue their own work in the field.

headline.main: Two Utilities Are Leaving Clean Coal Initiative
headline.print_headline: Two Utilities Are Leaving Clean Coal Initiative
